Dear Everton Families,

Under the Families First Coronavirus Response Act of 2020, families that qualify for free or reduced-price meals at school may be eligible for a new one-time Pandemic Electronic Benefits Transfer (P-EBT) of up to $302 per child (Pre-Kindergarten – Grade 12) to help cover the cost of meals students have eaten at home on days that schools have been closed. Students can receive P-EBT benefits even if they have been or continue to receive meals provided by the school district during the school closure. If your child was not previously eligible for free or reduced-price meals, but you have now lost income, you may be eligible to receive P-EBT benefits.

Please follow the link to a letter that will give you more details and links to help guide you. Please note that these applications are not to be returned to the school. Thank you! Stay safe, stay strong!

post_text: A message from our Agricultural Education Teacher, Mrs. Haleigh Harris. We wish Mrs. Harris, Anthony, and baby Dawson all of the best.
shared_text:
Everton FFA Chapter
March 26 at 4:16 PM ·

Everton FFA Members, Agriculture Students and Families,

As many of you may know, my husband, Anthony, and I had our baby boy this past December.

Dawson was born 11 weeks early, weighing only 2.5 pounds. Due to this unforeseen situation, we were in the neonatal intensive care unit for 64 days with our son. Thankfully he is doing really well and we have been home for a little over a month now.

With how premature Dawson’s lungs are, we are unable to leave him in someone else’s care until he is much older. This unfortunately ends my journey with Everton FFA and Agriculture Department.

It has been such a joy to be part of your community, and I will greatly miss being your FFA Advisor.

FFA Members, never stop advancing your leadership skills through FFA. You’ll never regret the experiences you have in your corduroy jacket.
I truly wish the best for all of you.

Thank you for providing me with such a great teaching experience!

Mrs. Harris
